smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function initializeChart is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function initializeUI is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function initializeChart appears to be too complex.
The function writeTag appears to be too complex.
The function btn_setAlarm appears to be too complex.
The function setAlarm appears to be too complex.
The function getLocalName appears to be too complex.
The function getLocalUrl appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function writeTag is nested too deeply.
Function btn_setAlarm is nested too deeply.
Function setAlarm is nested too deeply.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function sendNotification has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface ApplicationGraph is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Interface 'ApplicationGraph' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'
Class 'SqliteManager' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: VarCouldBeVal
smells.description: Var declaration could be val.

instances.message: Variable 'dGoal' could be val.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the package declaration and the list of imports.

smells.name: OptionalUnit
smells.description: Return type of 'Unit' is unnecessary and can be safely removed.

instances.message: The function destroy defines a return type of Unit. This is unnecessary and can safely be removed.

smells.name: CollapsibleIfStatements
smells.description: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

instances.message: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function writeTag has 5 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function checkGoalValid has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function getLocalName has 16 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function getLocalUrl has 16 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: MayBeConst
smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

instances.message: showMinutes can be a `const val`.
SVG_WATERDROP can be a `const val`.
preferenceKey can be a `const val`.

smells.name: UnusedPrivateMember
smells.description: Private member is unused.

instances.message: Function parameter v is unused.

smells.name: ThrowsCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of throw statements in methods.

instances.message: Too many throw statements in the function create. The maximum number of allowed throw statements is 2.

smells.name: LoopWithTooManyJumpStatements
smells.description: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

instances.message: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Capacity defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"NEWBE" to true`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"INIT_CAPACITY" to false`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"WaterGoal" to "2000"`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"localIndex" to 0`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"MyCup" to "0"`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"setWeatherAlarm" to false`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"BUBBLE_COLOR" to "#1c9ade"`

smells.name: NewLineAtEndOfFile
smells.description: Checks whether files end with a line separator.

instances.message: The file spotless.license.kt is not ending with a new line.

smells.name: TrailingWhitespace
smells.description: Checks which lines end with a whitespace.

instances.message: Line 16 ends with a whitespace.
